definition: Ban Chao (33-102), noted Han diplomat and military man
team/class/squad/work shift/ranking/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for groups
surname Ban
to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-

sentences.english: At night, Ban Chao and his 36 men snuck up to the Xiongnu camp.
sentences.chinese: 这天深夜，班超带了36个士兵潜到匈奴营地。

sentences.english: Just in this background, Ban Chao was sent to Xiyu in which he pursued anti-Hunnish activities for over thirty years.
sentences.chinese: 班超正是在这种情况下被派往西域，经略三十余年的。

definition: Zhang Qian (-114 BC), Han dynasty explorer of 2nd century BC
Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty (141-87 BC)
Li Ling (-74 BC), Han dynasty general whose defeat by the Xiongnu 匈奴 in 104 BC led to a major scandal
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
Han Dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
Wusun kingdom of central Asia (c. 300 BC-300 AD)
the Greater Yuezhi, a branch of the Yuezhi 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
Emperor Xuan (91-48 BC) of the Former Han Dynasty, reigned 74-48 BC
Yuan Emperor, reign name of Han Dynasty emperor Liu Shi 劉奭|刘奭[Liu2 Shi4], (74-33 BC), reigned 48-33 BC
Su Wu (140-60 BC), Han Dynasty diplomat and statesman, regarded as a model of courage and faithful service
Ban Gu (32-92), Eastern Han dynasty historian, wrote the Dynastic History of Western Han 漢書|汉书
Emperor Wen of Han (202-157 BC), fourth Han emperor, personal name Liu Heng 劉恆|刘恒[Liu2 Heng2], reigned 180-157 BC
Emperor Ming of Han (28-75), Western Han Dynasty Emperor 58-75
ancient state of central Asia
ancient Central Asian city state, flourished in first millennium AD, in modern Aksu 阿克蘇地區|阿克苏地区, Xinjiang
